title: Mathematics Educational Game Development Process Based on the Educational Reconstruction Model (MER)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of middle school-level basic math concepts
context.additional_context: Mathematical problem-solving competency enhancement program for professionals, applying mobile-based microlearning in BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environments

learning_goals: Learners apply the 3 core elements of the Educational Recontextualization Model (MER)—teaching-learning environment characteristics, design trajectory, and educational potential framework—to actual educational game development.
Learners explain a 3+ stage design process, including a pre-playful research phase, for designing Complex Educational Games (CEGs).
Learners create a portfolio analyzing the educational potential of the MER model in mobile-based microlearning environments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
